H0.text: What is the common name of the laryngeal prominence. Adam's Apple

H1.text: What is the common name of the laryngeal prominence. Voice Box Bump

H2.text: What is the common name of the laryngeal prominence. Neck Knot

H3.text: What is the common name of the laryngeal prominence. Pomum Adam

A4.text: The Adam's apple is the protrusion in the neck formed by the angle of the thyroid cartilage surrounding the larynx, typically visible in men, less frequently in women.

A5.text: The English term 'Adam's Apple' is a calque of Latin pomum Adami, which is found in European medical texts from as early as 1600.

A6.text: The topographic structure which is externally visible and colloquially called the 'Adam's apple' is caused by an anatomical structure of the thyroid cartilage called the laryngeal prominence or laryngeal protuberance protruding and forming a 'bump' under the skin at the front of the throat.
